description: Map all table columns to scenario parameters bidirectionally. Every column header maps to a Background/When/Then parameter, and every parameter appears as a column. Example: '{payment_system}' parameter â†’ 'Payment System' column.

do.description: Bidirectional mapping: column â†” parameter. Example: 'Payment System' column maps to '{payment_system}' parameter in Background

guidance.description: Every parameter in Background/When/Then appears as table column
example: Given Payment system is '{payment_system}' â†’ Table has 'Payment System' column

guidance.description: Every table column maps to a parameter
example: | Payment System | Rule File Paths | â†’ Background has '{payment_system}' and '{rule_file_paths}'

guidance.description: Column names clearly match parameter names

dont.description: Don't omit parameters from table or add columns without parameters. Example: '{payment_system}' in Background but no column (wrong)

guidance.description: Don't have parameters without matching columns
example: Given Payment system is '{payment_system}' but no 'Payment System' column (WRONG)

guidance.description: Don't have columns without matching parameters
example: 'Test Type' column but no '{test_type}' parameter in steps (WRONG)

guidance.description: Don't use vague column names that don't map to parameters
